document_title: Orchitis: Causes, signs, diagnosis and prevention
subsection_content:
Orchitis is treated by inhibiting the growth of pathogenic bacteria and relieving the symptoms the patient is experiencing. Most are medical treatment with oral medications.
For people with orchitis due to sexually transmitted infections, the doctor will prescribe a treatment regimen for these STDs before treating orchitis.
Patients are asked to rest in bed and limit activities that may affect the testicles. This creates conditions for the testicles to recover optimally. Besides, based on each symptom, medical history and physical condition of the patient, the doctor will prescribe appropriate medications.
Patients will be treated for orchitis with the following methods:
Use antibiotics if there are signs of infection, gonorrhea or syphilis; Use anti-inflammatory and pain relievers. These medications require the patient to strictly follow the dosage instructions from the doctor. Because if not used properly or overuse of anti-inflammatory drugs, patients will easily develop stomach ulcers; Patients need to rest and elevate their testicles to relieve pain; If the pain is severe, the patient can apply a cold compress to the testicles
